criteria: Accuracy of Identifying Food Group Servings
descriptions: Does not identify any food group servings correctly.
Identifies only one food group serving correctly.
Identifies some food group servings correctly, but with significant errors or omissions.
Identifies most food group servings correctly, but with minor errors or omissions.
Identifies all food group servings correctly for a child’s daily needs with only minor prompting.
Accurately and comprehensively identifies all food group servings necessary for a child’s daily needs, demonstrating a clear understanding of nutritional guidelines without prompting.
Demonstrates no understanding of appropriate serving sizes.
Demonstrates a minimal understanding of appropriate serving sizes.
Shows some understanding of serving sizes, but struggles with specific examples.
Generally understands serving sizes, but may have slight inaccuracies.
Accurately identifies appropriate serving sizes for each food group with only minor prompting.
Demonstrates a thorough and accurate understanding of appropriate serving sizes for all food groups without prompting.
Unable to apply knowledge of food groups to daily nutritional needs.
Attempts to apply knowledge, but is largely incorrect.
Shows some ability to relate food groups to daily needs, but with limited success.
Can relate food groups to daily needs with some inaccuracies.
Accurately relates food groups to a child's daily nutritional needs, demonstrating comprehension with only minor prompting.
Consistently and accurately applies knowledge of food groups and serving sizes to a child's daily nutritional needs without prompting.
